item.title: Trump Imposes Limited Tariffs on Foreign Semiconductors
item.description: The tariffs will allow President Trump to take a cut of Nvidia’s chip sales to China while putting off a decision about imposing higher taxes on the chip industry.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson and Tripp Mickle

item.title: Trump Credits ‘Mister Tariff’ for the Country’s Strength. Economists Beg to Differ.
item.description: Many indicators appear to suggest that the United States is growing despite tariffs, not because of them.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: 2026 May Be the Year of the Mega I.P.O.
item.description: If SpaceX, OpenAI and Anthropic go public, they will unleash gushers of cash for Silicon Valley and Wall Street.
item.dc:creator: Erin Griffith and Lauren Hirsch

item.title: As Trump Pushes Housing Affordability, His Mortgage Chief Undermines It
item.description: Under Bill Pulte, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have pulled away from efforts to help low-income people buy homes.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: In a Risky Gambit, Trump Tries Brute Force to Lower Prices
item.description: To assuage cost-weary voters and combat inflation, the president has resorted to a mix of threats and punishments, targeting companies and policymakers alike.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm

item.title: CPI Report Shows Inflation Remained Steady at 2.7% in December
item.description: Surging grocery prices were offset by lower increases for appliances and vehicles in the last such report before the Federal Reserve meets to debate interest rates.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: What to know about the report.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: CPI Report Shows Food Prices Rose Sharply in December
item.description: Beef, coffee and produce were among the items that surged in price, inflation data showed.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo

item.title: Why haven’t tariffs had a bigger impact on prices?
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Facing Political Pressure, Trump Seeks Answer to Rising Housing Costs
item.description: White House officials have explored a vast array of ideas as the president looks to unfurl a housing affordability plan at an economic conference this month.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm

item.title: Trump Administration Nears Trade Deal With Taiwan
item.description: The deal would cut tariffs and include a commitment from Taiwanese Semiconductor Manufacturing Corporation, the island’s chip giant, to build more manufacturing plants in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson and Tripp Mickle

item.title: Trump’s Feel-My-Pain Economic Message
item.description: The president appears skeptical about Americans’ concerns. How will voters respond?
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck

item.title: E.U. and South America to Form Free-Trade Zone With 700 Million People
item.description: The agreement represents a push for deeper global cooperation, in contrast to the United States’ turning to coercion in its dealings with other countries.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Cohen

item.title: U.S. Hiring Continues at Modest Pace, but Weaknesses Are Evident
item.description: The unemployment rate fell in December, but job growth across 2025 was the lowest in five years.
item.dc:creator: Talmon Joseph Smith

item.title: Jobs Report Shows U.S. Hiring Slowed One Year Into Trump’s Second Term
item.description: As economists pointed to some of the president’s policies to explain the latest Labor Department data, White House aides sought to make the case for optimism in the new year.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm and Ben Casselman

item.title: What to know about the report.
item.dc:creator: Talmon Joseph Smith

item.title: December’s Jobs Data Reinforces Fed’s Cautious Approach to Future Cuts
item.description: For the central bank to lower interest rates again, officials will likely need to see more notable signs that unemployment is rising.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Minimum Wage Rises in Some States as Workers Struggle With Basic Costs
item.description: This year, for the first time, more workers will live in states with a minimum wage of at least $15 per hour than in states with the federal minimum of $7.25.
item.dc:creator: Audra D. S. Burch

item.title: Nicolai Tangen Manages Trillions of Dollars, but His Podcast Made Him Famous
item.description: Nicolai Tangen wanted to raise the profile of Norway’s $2.1 trillion oil fund and change corporate behavior, but he may have helped embroil it in a geopolitical tangle.
item.dc:creator: Ravi Mattu

item.title: U.S. Trade Deficit Fell to Lowest Level Since 2009 as Tariffs Reshape Trade
item.description: The monthly trade deficit continued to shrink in October after President Trump imposed sweeping tariffs on imports, the latest data showed.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson
